newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil direct investment til March $2.6 bln - paper.
newsitem.headline: Brazil direct investment til March $2.6 bln - paper.

text.p: Direct investment in Brazil reached $2.689 billion in the first three months of this year with direct investment in March amounting to $1.617 billion, a financial newspaper said on Wednesday.

The Central Bank forecasts that Brazil could receive around $14 billion in direct investment in the whole of this year as a result of the privatization of state mining giant CVRD and telecommunications firms, Gazeta Mercantil said.
((--Simona de Logu, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 507 4151))
